*This page is about the player [species](/Species "Species"). For the monster, see [Merfolk (monster)](/Merfolk_\(monster\) "Merfolk (monster)"). For a list of all merfolk monsters, see [List of merfolk](/List_of_merfolk "List of merfolk").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The Merfolk are a hybrid species of half-human, half-fish that typically live in the oceans and rivers, seldom venturing toward land. However, Merfolk aren't as limited on land as some myths suggest; their tails will quickly reform into legs once they leave the water (and, likewise, their legs will quickly reform into a tail should they ever enter water). They tend to be surprisingly nimble on land as well as in the water. Experts at swimming, they need not fear drowning and move very quickly through water.The Merfolk have developed their martial arts strongly on thrusting and grappling, since those are the most efficient ways to fight underwater. They therefore prefer polearms and short swords above all other weapons, though they can also use longer swords quite well.As spellcasters, they tend to be quite good in specific areas. Their mystical relationship with water makes it easier for them to use poison and ice magic, which use water occasionally as a material component. The legendary water magic of the Merfolk was lost in ancient times, but some of that affinity still remains. The instability of their own morphogenic matrix has made them very accomplished transmuters, but most other magic seems foreign to them. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [5 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [6 History](#History)

## Innate Abilities

- **Nimble Swimmer 2:** Merfolk are [amphibious](/Amphibious "Amphibious"), meaning they can enter [deep water](/Deep_water "Deep water") and are immune to [Engulf](/Engulf "Engulf") and [drowning](/Drowning "Drowning") damage. When on/over water, they gain -4 aut [movement delay](/Movement_delay "Movement delay"), +50 [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth"), and +25% [EV](/EV "EV") (min +2).
- **Mertail:** When on/over water, Merfolk gain an [auxiliary tail slap](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack") (damage = 6). Their [boots](/Boots "Boots") meld into them and stop functioning, however.

Merfolk have a base [Strength](/Strength "Strength") of 8, [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 7 and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") of 9 (before Background modifiers).

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Warriors:** [Gladiator](/Gladiator "Gladiator")
- **Zealots:** [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker")
- **Adventurers:** [Shapeshifter](/Shapeshifter "Shapeshifter")
- **Mages:** [Summoner](/Summoner "Summoner"), [Ice Elementalist](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist"), [Alchemist](/Alchemist "Alchemist")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 to a random [stat](/Stat "Stat") every 5th level.
- Average [HP](/HP "HP") and [MP](/MP "MP").
- +3 [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") per level.

## Difficulty of Play

|                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Simple](/Category:Easy_species "Category:Easy species")** • [Intermediate](/Category:Moderate_species "Category:Moderate species") • [Advanced](/Category:Hard_species "Category:Hard species") |

Merfolk are a fairly straightforward species due to their well-defined strengths. Their movement speed and EV bonus in water can also come in handy, particularly in water-themed [vaults](/Vault "Vault"), the [Shoals](/Shoals "Shoals"), the [Swamp](/Swamp "Swamp"), and parts of the [Abyss](/Abyss "Abyss").

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), merfolk had aptitudes of +4 Polearms and +1 Long Blades.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), the [evasion](/Evasion "Evasion") bonus for swimming merfolk was capped at +9 EV.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), merfolk were immune to the [mesmerisation](/Mesmerise "Mesmerise") attempts of [mermaids](/Mermaid "Mermaid") and [sirens](/Siren "Siren").
- Merfolk's unstable nature persists not only across space, but apparently across time as well. In very old versions of the game, cursed boots would prevent them from swimming, as would wearing heavier armour. On the flip side, they used to have above-average HP, and [spears](/Spear "Spear") would be replaced by [tridents](/Trident "Trident") in their starting inventory, generally making their game even easier.

Merfolk

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

This page is about the player species. For the monster, see Merfolk (monster). For a list of all merfolk monsters, see List of merfolk.

The Merfolk are a hybrid species of half-human, half-fish that typically live in the oceans and rivers, seldom venturing toward land. However, Merfolk aren't as limited on land as some myths suggest; their tails will quickly reform into legs once they leave the water (and, likewise, their legs will quickly reform into a tail should they ever enter water). They tend to be surprisingly nimble on land as well as in the water. Experts at swimming, they need not fear drowning and move very quickly through water.

The Merfolk have developed their martial arts strongly on thrusting and grappling, since those are the most efficient ways to fight underwater. They therefore prefer polearms and short swords above all other weapons, though they can also use longer swords quite well.

As spellcasters, they tend to be quite good in specific areas. Their mystical relationship with water makes it easier for them to use poison and ice magic, which use water occasionally as a material component. The legendary water magic of the Merfolk was lost in ancient times, but some of that affinity still remains. The instability of their own morphogenic matrix has made them very accomplished transmuters, but most other magic seems foreign to them.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Difficulty of Play
  • 5 Skill aptitudes
  • 6 History

Innate Abilities

  • Nimble Swimmer 2: Merfolk are amphibious, meaning they can enter deep water and are immune to Engulf and drowning damage. When on/over water, they gain -4 aut movement delay, +50 stealth, and +25% EV (min +2).
  • Mertail: When on/over water, Merfolk gain an auxiliary tail slap (damage = 6). Their boots meld into them and stop functioning, however.

Merfolk have a base Strength of 8, Intelligence of 7 and Dexterity of 9 (before Background modifiers).

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Warriors: Gladiator
  • Zealots: Berserker
  • Adventurers: Shapeshifter
  • Mages: Summoner, Ice Elementalist, Alchemist

Level Bonuses

  • +1 to a random stat every 5th level.
  • Average HP and MP.
  • +3 willpower per level.

Difficulty of Play

Simple • Intermediate • Advanced

Merfolk are a fairly straightforward species due to their well-defined strengths. Their movement speed and EV bonus in water can also come in handy, particularly in water-themed vaults, the Shoals, the Swamp, and parts of the Abyss.

Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

History

  • Prior to 0.29, merfolk had aptitudes of +4 Polearms and +1 Long Blades.
  • Prior to 0.17, the evasion bonus for swimming merfolk was capped at +9 EV.
  • Prior to 0.14, merfolk were immune to the mesmerisation attempts of mermaids and sirens.
  • Merfolk's unstable nature persists not only across space, but apparently across time as well. In very old versions of the game, cursed boots would prevent them from swimming, as would wearing heavier armour. On the flip side, they used to have above-average HP, and spears would be replaced by tridents in their starting inventory, generally making their game even easier.
